ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became much more confident in conversational Polish, and learned a lot of new grammar. Past tense and future tense were well-explained, although they are quite confusing because Polish has both different aspects and verb genders.
A very good understanding of Polish grammar, vocabulary and linguistic structure. We also learned about Polish history and Polish culture.
Polish in past tense, future tense, vocab and grammar relating to geographic location, making plans with others, and a great amount of learning about polish history, culture, and art!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Krystyna is an amazing instructor who clearly cares a ton about teaching. She is very patient at explaining complex grammatical points, but also strongly believes in having us speak and make mistakes and learn to hear which phrases sounds correct instead of getting too hung up on grammar.

This is a tremendously interactive and enjoyable course. Professor Illakowicz is engaged, thoughtful, supportive and clearly very knowledgable. Her approach to teaching is to make students comfortable speaking out loud, allowing them to make mistakes.
Very well paced and organized, students have ample time to learn material and ask questions, and submit/correct homework on a daily basis for feedback

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, absolutely. Krystyna is wonderful, and the Polish language is really fun to speak.
Absolutely. Professor Illakowicz is a treasure, one of the best professors at Yale.
Absolutely! Polish is a great class for anyone trying to have fun while knocking out their foreign language requirement.
